prompt: <description>**Part 1: Three-dimensional, rectangular prism with a slightly tapered top and bottom** The first part is a three-dimensional, rectangular prism with a slightly tapered top and bottom. The sides are parallel, and the top and bottom faces are perpendicular to the sides. The dimensions of the prism are 3 units in length, 2 units in width, and 1 unit in height. To construct this part, follow these steps: 1. Create a new coordinate system with euler angles 0.0, 0.0, and 0.0, and translation vector 0.0, 0.0, 0.0. 2. Begin by creating a sketch on the X-Y plane. The sketch will have six lines. 3. Create the first line with the start point at (0.0, 0.4113) and the end point at (0.1375, 0.0577). 4. Create the second line with the start point at (0.1375, 0.0577) and the end point at (0.5125, 0.0). 5. Create the third line with the start point at (0.5125, 0.0) and the end point at (0.75, 0.2959). 6. Create the fourth line with the start point at (0.75, 0.2959) and the end point at (0.6125, 0.6495). 7. Create the fifth line with the start point at (0.6125, 0.6495) and the end point at (0.2375, 0.7072). 8. Create the sixth line with the start point at (0.2375, 0.7072) and the end point at (0.0, 0.4113). 9. Scale the sketch by a factor of 0.75. 10. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the euler angles and translation vector of the coordinate system. 11. Extrude the sketch along the z-axis to a depth of 0.0949 units, resulting in a slight taper on the top and bottom of the prism. The first part is now complete. The length, width, and height of this part are 0.75 units, 0.75 units, and 0.0949 units, respectively.</description>
